text: Hello! Sorry for the delayed reply, I was on leave. Thanks for this! Btw, is it also possible to migrate anything i did on the sandbox to another account?

I get what they did is like trying to view a single living cell that is on earth using a telescope on the moon. but lol you’d think with 8 telescopes capturing it, it’d be just slightly better resolution than the original winamp music player visualizations.
hehe i thought about winamp as well
anyone know if Google analytics has a default data attribute way of sending events?

Example simple links on a page - want to be able to add data attributes to cause them to get tracked.

Realize I could write my own script, just lazy
alternatively you can use tag manager as well
never personally actually used tag manager just told people about it. Hows that work? can the marketers some how define what links trigger an event through that?
Yup, its pretty simple once you setup the click event
lettme find an article real quick
just replace the "button" stuff with link things: <https://www.lovesdata.com/blog/google-tag-manager-button-click-tracking>

So, anyone got any good resources on web 3.0 development?
<https://blogs.opera.com/desktop/2019/04/opera-60-reborn-3-web-3-0-vpn-ad-blocker/>
never heard of it until now. looks like this is the official site: <https://web3.foundation/>

as I understand it from a video I watched, there is no true organization that’s like controling it like the W3C kinda thing. There’s group of people who are basically trying to educate  people on the idea, but actual implementation is  tons of different groups working on their own niche area, and then trying to work together with eachother so essentially the work toward web 3.0 itself is decentralized
